temples.name: Houston Texas Temple
temples.services: Distribution Center on Temple Grounds, Clothing available to rent
temples.history: Plans to construct the temple were announced 30 September 1997; Church leaders broke ground 13 June 1998 and Gordon B. Hinckley, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (1995-2008), dedicated the Houston Texas Temple 26 August 2000. The temple serves Latter-day Saints in Houston and the surrounding area.

temples.name: Dallas Texas Temple
temples.services: Distribution Center on Temple Grounds, Clothing available to rent
temples.history: Plans to construct the temple were announced 1 April 1981, Church leaders broke ground 22 January 1983, and President Gordon B. Hinckley, then a counselor in the First Presidency of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, dedicated the Dallas Texas Temple 19 October 1984. After a remodel, President Hinckley rededicated the temple 5 March 1989. The temple serves Latter-day Saints in Texas and Louisiana.

temples.name: San Antonio Texas Temple
temples.address: 20080 Stone Oak Parkway San Antonio, Texas
temples.services: Distribution Center on Temple Grounds, Clothing available to rent
temples.history: Plans to construct the temple were announced 24 June 2001, Church leaders broke ground 29 March 2003, and Gordon B. Hinckley, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints from 1995 to 2008, dedicated the San Antonio Texas Temple 22 May 2005. The temple serves Latter-day Saints in southwest Texas.

temples.name: Lubbock Texas Temple
temples.services: Distribution Center on Temple Grounds, Clothing available to rent
temples.history: Plans to construct the temple were announced 2 April 2000, Church leaders broke ground 4 November 2000, and Gordon B. Hinckley, president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints from 1995 to 2008, dedicated the Lubbock Texas Temple 21 April 2002. The temple serves Latter-day Saints in west Texas and eastern New Mexico.
